For example if chat is turned off or outside of business hours, you may want to disable the button or deflect customers to contact an email).

Enums/KustomerCore/ChatProvider.html#/s:.abstract: Marks a conversation as read as of right now. Any message received for this conversation after this will be treated as unread, until marked read again. This function should be called, whenever the user closes the chat view for a conversation.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:8Kustomer10KUSA.abstract: RequestRetrier threw an error during the request retry process.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:8Kustomer10KUSA.name: serverTrustEvaluationFailed(reason:)
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:8Kustomer10KUSA.abstract: ServerTrustEvaluating instance threw an error during trust evaluation.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:8Kustomer10KUSA.name: sessionDeinitialized
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:8Kustomer10KUSA.abstract: Session which issued the Request was deinitialized, most likely because its reference went out of scope.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:8Kustomer10KUSA.name: sessionInvalidated(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:8Kustomer10KUSA.abstract: Session was explicitly invalidated, possibly with the Error produced by the underlying URLSession.

Enums/KUSAFError.html.name: KUSAFError
Enums/KUSAFError.html.abstract: AFError is the error type returned by Alamofire. It encompasses a few different types of errors, each with

Enums/KustomerOffhoursDisplay.html.name: KustomerOffhoursDisplay
Enums/KustomerOffhoursDisplay.html.abstract: How to handle chat when outside of business hours

Enums/KUSChatMessageDirection.html.name: KUSChatMessageDirection
Enums/KUSChatMessageDirection.html.abstract: Is the message sent from a KUSCustomer to a KUSUser, or the other way around?

Enums/KUSConversationLockReason.html.name: KUSConversationLockReason
Enums/KUSConversationLockReason.html.abstract: Reason for the conversation being locked (closed, locked, and ended are all the same).

Enums/KError.html.name: KError
Enums/KError.html.abstract: Errors from the KustomerSDK. See the error’s localizedDescription property for a description the error.

Enums/KustomerAssetLanguage.html.name: KustomerAssetLanguage
Enums/KustomerAssetLanguage.html.abstract: An enum listing all the asset translations supported out of the box.

Enums/KustomerLanguage.html.name: KustomerLanguage
Enums/KustomerLanguage.html.abstract: Language used to render the Kustomer UI (all except KB).

Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: silentlyFailOnErrors
Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: As an SDK, we would rather the SDK show nonsense data or be broken than it crash the parent app. This enables this mode.

Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: backgroundContext
Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Single background context makes background processing all go on one context.

Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: mainContext
Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Use this context unless you’re doing background thread processing.

Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: persistentContainer
Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Loads the xcdatamodeld from the KustomerSDK framework, or, if it can’t be found, loads the KustomerSDK.xcdatamodeld file from the host application

Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: performVSync(_:)
Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Perform virtual synchronous block by using a DispatchGroup and .perform

Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: save()
Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Saves the mainContext if there are changes

Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: save(_:)
Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Save all data for the specified context.

Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: deleteAllEntities(context:)
Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Delete all entities saved to the persistent store.

Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: deleteEntity(_:context:)
Classes/CoreDataStack.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Delete all instances of an entity from core data’s persistent store

Classes/SupportCenter.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: openNewChat()
Classes/SupportCenter.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Creates a new chat session with default settings:

Classes/SupportCenter.html#/s:8Kustomer1.name: getTopViewController()
Classes/SupportCenter.html#/s:8Kustomer1.abstract: Gets the top view controller visible now

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: teamName
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: The name of the support team to be displayed

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: teamIconUrl
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: The URL where the team icon image can be found

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: widgetType
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: Whether to show chat, kb, or both

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: greeting
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: The greeting displayed when the organization is available

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: offhoursDisplay
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: How to handle chat when outside of business hours. Either act like the organization is online, show it as offline, or hide chat entirely.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: offhoursMessage
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: Greeting message to show at top of screen when offline (outside of business hours). Shown when outside of business hours (or during a holiday) and when offhoursDisplay == .offline

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: offhoursImageUrl
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: Image to display when offline (outside of business hours) on the blank new conversation screen.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: waitMessage
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: Message to show before an agent joins the conversation, at the top of the chat screen. Shown when inside of business hours and not during a holiday. If offlineDisplay == .online, this is also shown outside of business hours/holidays.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: activeAssistant
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: Chat assistant to use for all new conversations

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: enabled
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: If false, completely disables Kustomer. To edit, go to Channels > Chat > Settings > Enable Chat toggle on the Kustomer website.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: singleSessionChat
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: If true, customer can’t create a new chat if they already have one open

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: noHistory
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: when chats are “ended” they should vanish. vanish = not in history, not in unread count, none of their messages viewable

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: showTypingIndicatorWeb
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: If we should send typing indicators when the customer is typing on their phone.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.name: showTypingIndicatorCustomerWeb
Classes/Settings.html#/s:8Kustomer8Setti.abstract: Show if the agent is typing in the mobile sdk.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.name: enableUI
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.abstract: Enables the Kustomer UI. Defaults to true. If you want to use any of the Kustomer UI this must be true. To build your own UI, set to false.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.name: language
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.abstract: The language to show volume control, automated messages, snippets, and KB for. If blank, uses the device’s language.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.name: debugMode
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.abstract: Enable debug mode. Adds several menus that you can show by shaking the phone.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.name: pushPublishKey
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.abstract: Determines if the customer can start a new conversation from the chat view controller where a chat was closed

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.name: pushSubscribeKey
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.abstract: The subscribe key from your pubnub keyset for push notifications. must be registered by Kustomer for you. contact support to set this up.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.name: pushEnabled
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.abstract: Use push notifications? Requires additional configuration to work.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.name: businessScheduleId
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.abstract: The business schedule ID you want the app to use. Optional.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.name: logLevels
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.abstract: An array of KustomerLogTypes you want to have printed to the console. Defaults to all KustomerLogTypes: [.debug, .info, .error, .warning]. KustomerLogType.fatal errors are always logged.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.name: messageAttachmentLocalCacheMaximumSizeInBytes
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:8Kustome.abstract: Max size of local cache for message attachments. Defaults to 25MB. Minimum of 10MB, maximum of Int.max.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: chatProvider
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: This provider class is used to interact with all chat related functionality. See KustomerCore.ChatProvider

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: pushProvider
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: This provider is used to interact with push notification related functions. See KustomerCore.PushProvider

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: shared
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Shared, thread-safe, singleton

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: status
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: The status of the KustomerClient

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: bundle
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Bundle containing SDK resources

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: sdkVersion
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Version of the Kustomer SDK

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: sdkVersionBuild
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: options
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: The options used to configure the SDK. KustomerOptions for Kustomer. Once passed to configure, they can’t be changed.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: orgId
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: The organization ID. Derived from your api key.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: orgName
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Your organization’s name

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: keychain
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: A separate iOS keychain for the kustomer sdk inside your app.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: useCombinedInterface
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: configure(apiKey:options:launchOptions:file:function:line:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Configures the Kustomer SDK.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: isChatAvailable(_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: is it during business hours, incl. holidays? honors ‘show as available when outside business hours’

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: show()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Shows the Support Center in the default view

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: show(preferredView:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Attempts to show the Support Center in the preferred view. Mimics the buttons in the Kustomer UI.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: openConversation(id:completion:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Opens an existing conversation

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: openChatAssistant(id:completion:afterFirstMessage:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Starts a new chat with our bot using the passed chat assistant ID.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: showKbArticle(id:completion:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Loads the knowledge base at a specific article

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: logOut(_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Clears the user’s access to any existing chats from the device. If you’re using push, deregisters them from the Kustomer push service.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: logIn(jwt:_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Signs out the current customer if there is one. Then logs in as the customer w/ the JWT passed. Loads all their chat histories in the background, as network conditions permit.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: identifyCurrentCustomer(jwt:_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Securely identify a customer. If there are chats already started, links them to this customer. If the customer has any chat history from other devices, loads that history onto this device.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: openNewChat(initialMessages:afterCreate:animated:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Creates a new conversation.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotifications(error:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: If you’re using our push notifications, place this in your AppDelegate’s application(_ application: UIApplication, didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithError error: Error) method

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: didRegisterForRemoteNotifications(deviceToken:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: If you are using push notifications in the KustomerSDK call this function in your own AppDelegate, passing the parameters from func application(_ application: UIApplication, didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken deviceToken: Data)

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: deregisterCurrentDeviceForPushNotifications(_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Alias for KustomerCore.PushProvider.deregisterCurrentDeviceForPushNotifications(...)

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: requestAuthorizationForPush()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Alias for KustomerCore.PushProvider.requestAuthorizationForPush(...)

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: reconnect()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Use to reconnect manually.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: stop()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Disconnects from pubsub, stops receiving all events.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: start(completion:failure:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Creates the connection to the Kustomer SDK backend.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: start()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Alias for KustomerClient.start(...) with no callbacks. Use if you don’t care if the client starts or not. The client will auto start whenever the UI is shown, if you’re using the UI.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: start(completion:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Alias for KustomerClient.start(...) with only a completion callback

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: start(failure:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Alias for KustomerClient.start(...) with only a failure callback

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: unUserNotificationCenterDelegate
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: To process push notifications that don’t come from Kustomer, set this to your own UNUserNotificationCenterDelegate. Your delegate will not receive any pushes from Kustomer.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: getUnreadCount()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Immediately returns the current customer’s unread count. Use a KUSChatListener to be notified when this changes:

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: openConversationCount()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: See ChatProvider.openConversationCount(...)

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.name: removeAllSessionsAndRelatedData()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:8Kustomer.abstract: Removes all conversations and messages. Keeps the customer logged in. Keeps the SDK connected to pubsub and our platform.

Classes/KUSCustomer.html#/s:8Kustomer11K.name: currentId
Classes/KUSCustomer.html#/s:8Kustomer11K.abstract: the customer id of the currently logged in customer. if you don’t use identify, this is automatically created for you.

Classes/KUSCustomer.html#/s:8Kustomer11K.name: id
Classes/KUSCustomer.html#/s:8Kustomer11K.abstract: the unique ID of this customer. Used by the entire Kustomer platform.

Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.name: crl
Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.abstract: Perform revocation checking using the CRL (Certification Revocation List) method.

Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.name: networkAccessDisabled
Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.abstract: Consult only locally cached replies; do not use network access.

Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.name: ocsp
Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.abstract: Perform revocation checking using OCSP (Online Certificate Status Protocol).

Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.name: preferCRL
Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.abstract: Prefer CRL revocation checking over OCSP; by default, OCSP is preferred.

Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.name: requirePositiveResponse
Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.abstract: Require a positive response to pass the policy. If the flag is not set, revocation checking is done on a

Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.name: any
Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.abstract: Perform either OCSP or CRL checking. The checking is performed according to the method(s) specified in the

Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.name: KUSOptions
Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator/KUSO.abstract: Represents the options to be use when evaluating the status of a certificate.

Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator.html.name: KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator
Classes/KUSRevocationTrustEvaluator.html.abstract: An evaluator which Uses the default and revoked server trust evaluations allowing you to control whether to validate

Classes/KUSChatAttachment.html.name: KUSChatAttachment
Classes/KUSChatAttachment.html.abstract: A file, image, or video attachment sent with a KUSChatMessage. Belongs to a single KUSConversation and KUSChatMessage.

Classes/KUSChatMessage.html.name: KUSChatMessage
Classes/KUSChatMessage.html.abstract: A message between the current KUSUser and an support agent (KUSUser) or bot. Belongs to a single KUSConversation.

Classes/KUSChatSettings.html.name: KUSChatSettings
Classes/KUSChatSettings.html.abstract: A value object representing the settings of the kustomer sdk that can be set from our website.

Classes/KUSConversation.html.name: KUSConversation
Classes/KUSConversation.html.abstract: A conversation between a KUSCustomer and zero or more KUSUsers.

Classes/KUSCustomer.html.name: KUSCustomer
Classes/KUSCustomer.html.abstract: A customer is a person who uses your app. A customer receives customer support messags from one or more KUSUsers.

Classes/KUSUser.html.name: KUSUser
Classes/KUSUser.html.abstract: A user is a customer service agent or bot that sends messages to one of your customers (KUSCustomer)

Classes/KustomerClient.html.name: KustomerClient
Classes/KustomerClient.html.abstract: A singleton. This is how you interact with the Kustomer SDK.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html.name: KustomerOptions
Classes/KustomerOptions.html.abstract: Initialization options. Pass them to KustomerClient.configure(...) override any settings within the sdk.

Classes/Settings.html.name: Settings
Classes/Settings.html.abstract: Settings for your org. Fetched from the REST API. Change them on the Kustomer website, and restart your app to see the new ones. They are saved locally so you can use parts of the Kustomer SDK while offline (assuming you’ve configured and opened the Kustomer UI (regular SDK) or configured and called start(...) once (build your own UI SDK) at least once with an active internet connection).

Classes/SupportCenter.html.name: SupportCenter
Classes/SupportCenter.html.abstract: Controls the Kustomer UI. See https://kustomer.readme.io/docs for current docs.

Global%20Variables.html.name: Global Variables
Global%20Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
